page.title: 10EMPLOYMENT
page.content: {EMPLOYMENT}in the block is predominantly in {FARMING,}although some men still work for the {FORESTRY {COMMISSION.}A growing number of people travel into Hawick to work in the{ {KNITWEAR FACTORIES}or other jobs.Of those employed in the area,diverse occupations such as teachers, lorry drivers,gamekeeper,librarian,nurse, home-helps,building workers,potters, were noted.There is virtually no unemployment in the area,but this is because those without work are virtually forced by circumstance to move,as most farm workers cottages belong to employers.The local{ {BLACKSMITH}employs two men who do many repairs to farm machinery,and indeed the skills needed on the farms are varied;shepherds,tractormen,managers, cattlemen.
